translation: The Fourth and Second Part of the Chapter on Hell

source_sentence: 「復次，諸比丘！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中諸眾生等，經無量時受極苦已，然後從此五百由旬燋渴獄出，
translation: The sentient beings in that hell experience extreme pain for an immeasurable number of moments, and then they emerge from this hell five hundred yojanas away.

source_sentence: 奔走如前，略說乃至，求救護處。
translation: They run as before, briefly explaining up to the point where they seek protection.

source_sentence: 即復往詣膿血地獄，其地獄亦廣五百由旬，膿血遍滿，深至咽喉，悉皆熱沸。
translation: They immediately return to the hell of pus and blood, which is also five hundred yojanas in width. Filled with pus and blood, it flows deep into their throats and everything boils hot.

source_sentence: 地獄眾生入其中已，東西南北，交橫馳走。
translation: The sentient beings in this hell enter it and flee east, west, south, and north.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生，如是走時，燒手燒足、燒耳燒鼻；
translation: When those sentient beings walk in this way, they burn their hands, feet, ears, and nose.

source_sentence: 手足耳鼻，既被燒已，一切支節，皆亦燒燃；
translation: When the hands, feet, ears, and nose are burned, all their limbs are also burned.

source_sentence: 其身支節，被燒燃時，諸罪人等，受大苦惱，嚴酷重切，不可思議。
translation: When their limbs of body are burned, the sinners experience great pain and suffering, which is unfathomable in its severity and severity.

source_sentence: 乃至人非人身所造所作惡不善業，未畢已來，命亦不盡。
translation: Even bad and unskillful actions created by humans or non-human bodies don't end until their life has ended.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸比丘！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 膿血地獄復有諸蟲，名最猛勝，此諸蟲等，為彼地獄受罪眾生，大作惱害。
translation: Again, there are worms in the hell of pus and blood that are called the most intense. These worms and so forth do great harm to sentient beings in this hell who suffer from their sins.

source_sentence: 從身外入，先破其皮；
translation: Entering from the outside of their bodies, they first pierced their skin.

source_sentence: 既破皮已，次破其肉；
translation: Having broken the skin, he breaks the flesh.

source_sentence: 既破肉已，次破其筋；
translation: Having broken the flesh, he breaks its tendons in turn.

source_sentence: 既破筋已，次破其骨；
translation: Having broken the tendons, he then broke the bones.

source_sentence: 既破骨已，拔出其髓，隨而食之。
translation: Having broken the bones, he pulled out the marrow and ate it.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生，當於是時受極重苦。
translation: Those sentient beings will experience extreme pain and suffering at that point.

source_sentence: 乃至若人非人所造所作惡不善業，未盡未滅，壽命不盡，皆悉具受。
translation: Even if someone's bad and unskillful actions created by people or non-people have yet to end or cease, and their life span doesn't end, they'll all experience them.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸比丘！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 膿血地獄所有眾生，飢渴逼急，或時以手掬取如是熱沸膿血，置於口中，
translation: All the sentient beings in this hell of pus and blood suffer from hunger and thirst, sometimes scooping up hot boiling pus and blood like this with their hands and putting it in their mouths.

source_sentence: 置口中已，彼人脣口，應時燒燃；
translation: After they put it in their mouths, the lips and mouths of those beings will be burned at that moment.

source_sentence: 燒脣口時，即燒其腭；
translation: When their lips and mouths are burned, the palate is burned.

source_sentence: 既燒腭已，即燒其喉；
translation: Having burned the palate, he then burns his throat.

source_sentence: 如是燒胸，燒心燒腸燒胃；
translation: Thus, it burns the chest; it burns the heart; it burns the intestines; it burns the stomach.

source_sentence: 既燒胃已，直過小腸，從下分出。
translation: After it has burned the stomach, it goes straight beyond the small intestine and emerges from the bottom.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生，於此地獄，受如是等嚴切重苦，命報未終。
translation: Those sentient beings will experience this kind of intense pain in this hell before their life ends.

source_sentence: 乃至未盡人非人身，曾所造作惡不善業，如是次第，具足受之。
translation: Even if they haven't ended the bad and unskillful actions of humans and non-human bodies that they've done in the past, they'll be fully received in this order.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸比丘！
translation: Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中諸眾生等，經無量時受極苦已，然後從此五百由旬膿血獄出，
translation: The sentient beings in that hell experience extreme pain for an immeasurable number of moments, and then they emerge from this hell of pus and blood for five hundred yojanas.

source_sentence: 如前馳走，乃至追求救護之處。
translation: It's like the previous one, chasing away and even pursuing a place to rescue it.

source_sentence: 即復來入一銅釜獄，其獄亦廣五百由旬。
translation: He then came back and entered a copper cauldron hell, which was also five hundred yojanas wide.

source_sentence: 罪人入已，獄卒見之，即前捉取，擲置釜內，頭皆向下，脚皆在上。
translation: Seeing him, the guards of this hell seize him and toss him into the cauldron. The sinners are thrown downward with their heads and feet facing upward.

source_sentence: 是諸眾生在湯中時，地獄猛火極相煎迫。
translation: When these sentient beings are in the boiling water, they're tormented by a fierce fire in hell.

source_sentence: 逐沸上時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When one goes up to the boiling, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 逐沸下時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: At the time of going downward in the boiling, they are also cooked and roasting.

source_sentence: 在中間時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: In the intermediate state, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 交橫往來，隨轉動時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When they go and come one after the other, both roasting and boiling are cooked as they move.

source_sentence: 湯沫覆時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When the foam of hot water covers them, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 若見不見，一切時煑。
translation: If they see or don't see, they'll be deceived at all times.

source_sentence: 譬如世間或煑小豆大豆豌豆，置之釜內，著水令滿，下燃大火，於是涌沸，
translation: Good man, it is analogous to someone in the world who puts into a cauldron all the rice and beans he eats, along with some of the small grains and so forth. He adds water to make them full, and then pours down a great fire that burns until they are boiled.

source_sentence: 湯豆和合。
translation: It's a combination of hot water and beans.

source_sentence: 浮向上時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When they float upward, they are also cooked and cooked.

source_sentence: 沈向下時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When it sinks downward, it is also scorched and scorched.

source_sentence: 住於中時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When they abide in the midst of it, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 交橫動時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When they interlock and move one after the other, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 為沫覆時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When the foam covers them, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 若見不見，一切時煑。
translation: If they see or don't see, they'll be deceived at all times.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如是如是，一銅釜獄，其中守卒，取彼罪人，以頭向下，以脚向上，擲置銅釜。
translation: Thus and so forth, the guards in this hell seize the offenders with their heads facing downward and feet facing upward, tossing the copper cauldron.

source_sentence: 在釜中時，地獄猛火之所煎逼，熱沸既盛，罪人逐沸或上或下，隨煑隨煎，
translation: When they're in the cauldron, they're tormented by a fierce fire in hell, and their boiling is so intense that offenders are boiled upward or downward as they go along with it.

source_sentence: 略說乃至若見不見，一切時煑，亦復如是。
translation: The same applies up to when seeing or not seeing: at all moments it is spoken of briefly.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生，於此獄中，受嚴劇苦。
translation: Those sentient beings will suffer intense pain and suffering in this hell.

source_sentence: 乃至往昔人非人身所作惡業，如是次第，於此地獄，具足而受。
translation: Even in the past people did bad actions that weren't done by humans, and they were fully subject to them in this hell in order.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中諸眾生等，經無量時受此苦已，從一銅釜五百由旬小地獄出，
translation: Sentient beings in that hell experience this pain for an immeasurable number of moments, and then emerge from the small hell of a copper cauldron five hundred yojanas long.

source_sentence: 奔走如前，乃至欲求救護之處。
translation: They run as before, even to the point where they want to be rescued.

source_sentence: 爾時，即入眾多銅釜小地獄中，其獄亦廣五百由旬。
translation: At that point, they'll enter many copper-bottle small hells, which are also five hundred yojanas wide.

source_sentence: 罪人入已，時守獄者即來執之，捉取罪人，以脚向上，以頭向下，擲銅釜中，
translation: Having entered, the guards in this hell seize the offenders and throw them into a copper cauldron.

source_sentence: 地獄猛火，熾燃煎逼，湯沸上時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: Hell is a blazing fire that burns and crushes. When the boiling water reaches the top, it’s both scorched and scorched.

source_sentence: 湯沸下時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: When the water boils down, they are also cooked and cooked.

source_sentence: 在中間時，亦煎亦煑；
translation: In the intermediate state, they are also cooked and roasted.

source_sentence: 縱橫掩覆，若見不見，一切煎煑。
translation: They are covered horizontally and vertically, and if they see or don't see them, everything is devoured.

source_sentence: 譬如煮豆，以火煎逼，涌沸上時，亦煎亦煮，略說乃至，若見不見，一切煎煑。
translation: It's like boiling beans that are devoured and crushed by fire, and when they rise into a boil, they're also devoured and boiled, and it's briefly explained up to the point where everything is devoured if you see or don't see them.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如是如是，此多銅釜五百由旬小地獄中，諸眾生等，為守獄卒，捉其兩脚，
translation: Thus and so forth, this much copper cauldron is located in a small hell five hundred yojanas from here. Sentient beings guard it by grasping its two legs.

source_sentence: 到竪其身，以頭向下，擲銅釜內。
translation: When he arrived, he touched his body, faced downward with his head, and tossed it into the copper pot.

source_sentence: 彼人于時被地獄火之所煎逼，或上或下，縱橫轉動，略說乃至若見不見，
translation: That person will be tormented by the fire of hell at that very moment. They may go upward or downward, going horizontally and vertically, speaking briefly until they see it.

source_sentence: 一切煎煑，亦復如是。
translation: The same applies to all kinds of cooked meat.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 此多銅釜五百由旬小地獄中，諸眾生等，又為獄卒，以其鐵爪，漉取罪人，
translation: In this hell, which is five hundred yojanas in circumference, the sinners are thrown into a copper cauldron.

source_sentence: 從釜至釜，次第煑之。
translation: From the cauldron to the cauldron, they were cooked one by one.

source_sentence: 從此釜出，詣餘釜時，膿血皮肉，縱橫流散，於是皆盡，唯餘骸骨。
translation: When he came out of the cauldron and went to another cauldron, pus, blood, skin, and flesh flowed horizontally and vertically. Thereupon they all ran out but skeletons remained.

source_sentence: 罪人爾時，受極重苦，仍未命終。
translation: At the time, the sinners were suffering extreme pain and still hadn't died.

source_sentence: 乃至若人非人一切身中所作惡業，不盡不滅，於此獄中，一切悉受。
translation: Even if someone's bad actions in all their bodies, whether human or non-human, don't end or cease, they'll experience them all in this prison.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中諸眾生等，經無量時受此苦已，從多銅釜五百由旬小地獄出，
translation: Sentient beings in that hell experience this pain for an immeasurable number of moments, and then emerge from the small hell of many copper cauldrons at a distance of five hundred yojanas.

source_sentence: 馳走如前，乃至欲求救護之處。
translation: They run about as before, even wanting to rescue and protect them.

source_sentence: 爾時，即入鐵磑地獄，其獄亦廣五百由旬。
translation: At that point, he'll enter the iron-brick hell, which is also five hundred yojanas wide.

source_sentence: 既入中已，時守獄卒即前捉取受罪眾生，仰撲置於鐵砧之上，熾燃猛焰，
translation: Having entered, the guards in this hell seize the offenders and throw them upright on an iron stake that glows with a blazing flame.

source_sentence: 一時洞燃，於是罪人，悶絕仰臥。
translation: One time, he was engulfed in flames, and the sinners were tormented and lying cross-legged.

source_sentence: 時，守獄卒更取大石，從上壓之；
translation: The guards in this hell then again took the large rock and crushed it from above.

source_sentence: 壓已復壓，因更研之；
translation: After pressing it, he presses it again; and then grinds it further.

source_sentence: 研已復研，遂成碎末；
translation: After grinding it, he refines it again and finally forms the powder.

source_sentence: 成碎末已，又更重末，末已復末，轉成細末；
translation: After forming the powder, it disintegrates and becomes coarse again; after becoming coarse again, it turns into fine powder.

source_sentence: 取其細末，又更研之，研已復研，於是乃成末中之末，最微細末。
translation: He takes the fine powder and polishes it further. After polishing it, he polishes it again. Thereupon, he forms a powder within the powder, the very subtlest of all powders.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，罪人身體，膏血腦髓，一邊橫流，微細骨末，猶尚存在，而於其間，
translation: At that moment, the corpse of the sinners was covered with grease, blood, brain and marrow, flowing horizontally from one side to the other. The fine bones and dust remained there still.

source_sentence: 命報未終，一切時中，受極重苦。
translation: Before the end of their life, they'll experience extreme pain and suffering at all times.

source_sentence: 乃至人非人身，所作惡業，未失未滅，如是次第具足受之。
translation: Even bad actions done by humans and non-human bodies that haven't been lost or extinguished are received in order like this.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中諸眾生等，經無量時受此苦已，乃從鐵磑五百由旬小地獄出，
translation: Sentient beings in that hell experience this kind of suffering for an immeasurable number of time, and then emerge from the small hell of iron spike five hundred yojanas long.

source_sentence: 馳走如前，欲求室宅，欲求歸依覆護之處。
translation: They ran about as before, wanting to search for their house and the place where they lived. They wanted to take refuge in the shelter.

source_sentence: 爾時，即入凾量地獄，其獄亦廣五百由旬。
translation: At that point, he'll enter the hell of anger, which is also five hundred yojanas wide.

source_sentence: 既入中已，時守獄卒執取罪人，付以鐵凾，令其量火，其凾猛熱，光焰熾燃，
translation: Having entered, the guards in this hell seize the offenders and hand them over to an iron plate that contains a great deal of flame. The fire is so intense that it burns brightly and blazing hot.

source_sentence: 地獄罪人，量彼火時，燒手燒脚、燒耳燒鼻、燒諸支節，乃至遍燒一切身分。
translation: When the sinners in hell measure their fire, they burn their hands, feet, ears, nose, limbs, and even all their bodies.

source_sentence: 於被燒時，此諸罪人，受極重苦、受重痛苦，然其壽命，未得終盡。
translation: When they are burned, these sinners experience extreme pain and suffering, but their lives won't end until they're burned.

source_sentence: 乃至往昔若人非人一切身中，有所造作惡不善業，不滅不沒、不離不失，
translation: In the past, if someone did bad and unwholesome actions in all their bodies, they wouldn’t cease, sink, part, or lose them.

source_sentence: 如是次第，具足受之。
translation: In this order, they're fully accepted.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中所有眾生，經無量時受此苦已，得從凾量五百由旬小地獄出，
translation: All the sentient beings in that hell suffered this pain for an immeasurable number of moments, and were able to emerge from the small hell measuring five hundred yojanas in size.

source_sentence: 馳走如前，求室求覆、求救求洲、求歸依處。
translation: They run around as before, seeking shelter and cover, rescue and islands, and refuge.

source_sentence: 爾時，即入雞小地獄，其獄亦廣五百由旬。
translation: He then entered the small hell of chickens, which was also five hundred yojanas in width.

source_sentence: 彼地獄中，純生諸雞，遍滿彼獄，其雞身分，乃至膝脛，一切猛熱，光焰熾燃。
translation: In that hell, purely born chickens pervade the hell. Their bodies and limbs, up to their knees and shins, are all ablaze with a blazing flame of light burning brightly.

source_sentence: 是諸眾生，處在其中，東西馳走，足蹈熱焰，四向顧望，無處可依，大火熾燃，
translation: These sentient beings are there, running east and west, with their feet touching the blazing fire. Looking in all directions, they have no place to rely on. A great fire is burning brightly.

source_sentence: 燒手燒脚、燒耳燒鼻，如是次第，燒諸支節，大小身分，一時洞燃。
translation: They burn the hands, burn the feet, burn the ears, burn the nose, and so forth in order, burning the limbs, large and small, all at once engulfed in flames.

source_sentence: 罪人爾時，受極重苦，痛切荼毒，然於其處，命報未終。
translation: At the time, the sinners were suffering extreme pain and suffering, with pain and cuts and poison, but their lives didn't end there.

source_sentence: 乃至人非人身所造惡業，未滅未盡，如是次第，一切具受。
translation: Even bad actions created by humans and non-human bodies that have yet to be extinguished or exhausted are received in this order.

source_sentence: 「諸比丘！
translation: “Monks!

source_sentence: 彼地獄中諸眾生等，經無量時受此苦已，得從如是雞地獄出，馳走如前，
translation: The sentient beings in that hell experience this kind of suffering for an immeasurable number of moments, and then they emerge from the hell of such a fowl and run away like before.

source_sentence: 乃至欲求救護之處。
translation: It's even a place where they want to seek salvation.

source_sentence: 爾時，即入灰河地獄，其獄亦廣五百由旬。
translation: At that point, they'll enter the ash-river hell, which is also five hundred yojanas wide.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 時彼灰河，流注漂疾，波浪騰涌，其聲吼震，灰水沸溢，彌盈兩岸。
translation: At that time the river A Forest of Pearls from the Dharma Garden, Volume II The ashes flowed down and floated fast. The waves rose high and their voices roared with reverberation. Overflowing with ash water, they filled both sides.

source_sentence: 罪人入已，隨流出沒，灰河之底，悉是鐵刺，其鋒纖利，皆若新磨。
translation: At the bottom of the ash river is an iron thorn whose tip is as slender and sharp as if it were newly ground.

source_sentence: 於河兩岸，復有刀林，森竦稠密，極可怖畏。
translation: On both banks of the river there was also a forest of swords, dense and dense with trees that were extremely fearsome.

source_sentence: 刀林之中，復有諸狗，其形烟黑，皮毛垢汙，又甚可畏。
translation: In the forest of swords there were also dogs with smoky, black-colored flesh and hair that looked terrifying.

source_sentence: 岸上復有眾多獄卒，守彼地獄。
translation: On the shore, there were also many jailers guarding that hell.

source_sentence: 又其兩岸，別生無量奢摩羅樹，其樹多刺，並皆纖長，其鋒若磨。
translation: On both sides of the mountain there are innumerable śāmalā trees that grow separately. Each tree has many thorns and is slender and long, with a sharp point like a brush.

source_sentence: 爾時，地獄諸眾生等，既入河中，欲趣彼岸。
translation: It was then that the sentient beings in hell entered the river and wanted to reach the other shore.

source_sentence: 當於是時，便為大波之所淪沒，遂至河底，即為河中所有鐵刺，仰刺其身，
translation: At that moment, he was submerged by a great wave and ended up at the bottom of the river. The iron thorns in the river pierced him all over his body.

source_sentence: 舉體周遍，不得移動，罪人在中，受大重苦、受嚴毒苦；
translation: Their bodies touched the ground but they could not move, and the sinners were tormented by great pain and suffered extreme pain.

source_sentence: 受之既久，方得浮出，從沸灰河，渡至彼岸。
translation: After accepting it for a long time, he was able to float out and crossed the Puṣavyāvahā River to the farther shore.

source_sentence: 既上岸已，復入刀林，其林甚闊，枝莖稠密，經歷林間，㒻突利刀，處處經過，
